name: The unitary Jordan totient function applied to the exponentially odd numbers (A268335).
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Sum_{k=1..n} a(k) ~ c * n^3, where c = (zeta(6)/(3*d^3)) * Product_{p prime} (1 - 1/p^2 + 1/p^5 - 2/p^6 + 1/p^7) = 0.59726984314764530141..., and d = A065463 is the asymptotic density of the exponentially odd numbers.
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := p^(2*e)-1; uj2[1] = 1; uj2[n_] := Times @@ f @@@ FactorInteger[n]; expOddQ[n_] := AllTrue[FactorInteger[n][[;; , 2]], OddQ]; uj2 /@ Select[Range[100], expOddQ]
program: list(lim) = apply(uj2, select(isexpodd, vector(lim, i, i)));
author: _Amiram Eldar_, Apr 02 2025

name: The unitary totient function applied to the exponentially odd numbers (A268335).
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Sum_{k=1..n} a(k) ~ c * n^2, where c = (zeta(4)/(2*d^2)) * Product_{p prime} (1 - 2/p^2 + 2/p^3 - 2/p^4 + 1/p^5) = 0.504949539649594981601..., and d = A065463 is the asymptotic density of the exponentially odd numbers.
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := p^e-1; uphi[1] = 1; uphi[n_] := Times @@ f @@@ FactorInteger[n]; expOddQ[n_] := AllTrue[FactorInteger[n][[;; , 2]], OddQ]; uphi /@ Select[Range[100], expOddQ]
program: list(lim) = apply(uphi, select(isexpodd, vector(lim, i, i)));
author: _Amiram Eldar_, Apr 02 2025
